info.title: Incident Management API
info.description: Incident Management API. See older version [here](/documentation/index-apidoc.html#api-Incident)

get.summary: Returns a list of incidents.
get.description:
| Permission | Remarks |
| ------- | --------|
| Operator   |  With read permission on 1st/2nd line incident; Category/Branch/Operator filters apply  |
| Person   |  Accessible; Person visibility settings apply |

parameters.name: pageStart
parameters.description: The offset to start at. The default is 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many incidents should be returned max. Default is 10.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort order of the returned incidents. Incidents can be ordered by most of the fields. But for best performance one should order by one of the following fields: callDate, creationDate,
modificationDate, targetDate, closedDate or id. It's faster to order by 1 field only. To specify if the order should be ascending or descending,
append ":asc" or ":desc" to the field name. Multiple columns can be specified by comma-joining the
orderings. Example: sort=tragetDate:asc,creationDate:desc.
Fields not allowed for sorting are: externalLinks, escalationStatus, action, attachments, partialIncidents, partialIncidents.link

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A FIQL string to select which incidents should be returned. (See [Tutorial](https://developers.topdesk.com/tutorial.html#query))

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of which fields should be returned. By default all fields will be returned. (slow)

parameters.name: dateFormat
parameters.description:
Format of date fields in json. When set to iso8601 dates will be sent in the form of '2020-10-01T14:10:00Z'.
Otherwise old date format will be used: '2020-10-01T14:10:00.000+0000'

parameters.name: all
parameters.description:
when present or when present and set to true will make all incident to be returned. Including partials and archived.
This overrides the default behaviour when only _firstLine_ and _secondLine_ incidents are returned by default. This can
be used in combinations with _query_ parameter to narrow down the requited statuses.

x-next-page-url.description: A link that returns the next list of incidents

400.description:
_Bad Request_
  • The parameters of the request were malformed

500.description:
_Internal Server Error_
  • Error occurred on the server

post.description:
| Permission | Remarks | | ------- | --------| | Operator | With create permission on 1st/2nd line incident, partials require 2nd line create permission | | Person | Can only create first line incidents for himself. Only the following fields can be set depending on the setting for the new call form:
  • request
  • briefDescription
  • callType
  • category
  • subcategory
  • object
  • request
  • location
  • operatorGroup
|

400.description:
_Bad Request_
  • The incident id is invalid
  • The request contains a field that does not exist
  • The request contains a value for a field where the format is wrong. For example, "true" mistyped, or the UUID in the wrong format
  • The request contains a value for a string field which is too long. For example, brief description can only be 80 characters long
  • The request contains an operator which does not belong to the given operator group
  • The request contains a subcategory which does not belong to the given category
  • The request contains a supplier which is not applicable for the status of the incident
  • The request contains an invalid major call
  • The person tries to give feedback on an open incident
  • The request is for the creation of a partial incident and one of the fields marked as 'Cannot be provided for partials' is included in the request.
  • The request is for the creation of a partial incident and no main incident id is provided.

403.description:
_Forbidden_
  • The request contains a field that the person is not allowed to set
  • The operator does not have the rights to execute this operation

404.description:
_Not Found_
  • The incident number or id are valid, but incident does not exist
  • The request contains a field with an id value which is not existing in the database

500.description:
_Internal Server Error_
  • Error occurred on the server

get.summary: Returns an incident.
get.description:

| Operator   |  With read permission on 1st/2nd line incident; Category/Branch/Operator filters apply  |

get.summary: Get list of time registrations. By default only time registartions entries for 1st and 2nd line incidents are returned

parameters.name: pageStart
parameters.description: The offset to start at. The default is 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many entries should be returned max. Default is 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort order of the returned entries. To specify if the order should be ascending or descending
append ":asc" or ":desc" to the field name. Multiple columns can be specified by comma-joining the
orderings. Example: sort=timeSpent:asc,creationDate:desc. By default entries are sorted by modificationDate:desc, creationDate:desc

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A FIQL string to select which incidents should be returned.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of which fields should be returned. By default only id will be returned. The name of fields corresponds to the names
returned in response.

400.description:
_Bad Request_
  • The parameters of the request were malformed

500.description:
_Internal Server Error_
  • Error occurred on the server

get.summary: Returns an timeregistration by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The uuid of the time registartion

get.summary: Get incident progress trail by incident id
get.description:
| Permission | Remark |
| ----- | --------- |
| Operator| With read permission on 1st/2nd line incident; Category/Branch/Operator filters apply |
| Person | Accessible; Person visibility settings apply |

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: incident id

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset at which to start listing the progress trail entries at

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The amount of progress trail entries to be returned per request

parameters.name: inlineimages
parameters.description: Whether inline images should be returned

parameters.name: non_api_attachment_urls
parameters.description: Whether links to attachments and bigger versions of inline images should be returned in a format that can be used by a browser (with cookie authentication) instead of by an API user

200.description:
_Success_
* Up to ```page_size``` entities have been found

206.description:
_Success_
* More than ```page_size``` entities have been found, but only so many are returned

400.description:
_Bad Request_
  • The parameters of the request were malformed

500.description:
_Internal Server Error_
  • Error occurred on the server

get.summary: Get list of SLA services
get.description:
| Permission | Remark |
|---------|-----------|
| Operator | With read permission on 1st/2nd line incident |
| Person | No access |

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The amount of SLA services to be returned per request. There is no way to request later 'pages', provide more specific filter parameters instead.

parameters.name: incident
parameters.description: An incident number or identifier. If specified, all other filter parameters are ignored, and exactly those SLA services that could apply to the incident will be returned. This filter accounts for the strict/loose validity setting, and contract start and end date.

parameters.name: contract
parameters.description: Return only SLA services for the specified contract id. If specified, the other filter parameters that determine the contract (including 'person') are ignored.

parameters.name: person
parameters.description: Shortcut for filtering contract. The values from the person card are used for the contract filtering options. If specified, the other filter parameters that determine the contract (except contractDate) are ignored.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: A service name or id. If specified, the other filter parameters that determine the service are ignored.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified branch. The Contract for head branch valid for subsidiary branches' setting is applied.

parameters.name: budgetHolder
parameters.description: Name or id of a budget holder. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified budget holder.

parameters.name: department
parameters.description: Name or id of a department. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified department.

parameters.name: branchExtraA
parameters.description: Name or id of a branchExtraA. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified branchExtraA.

parameters.name: branchExtraB
parameters.description: Name or id of a branchExtraB. Return only SLA services where the contract applies to the specified branchExtraB.

parameters.name: contractDate
parameters.description: Date on which the contract needs to be valid. If not specified, defaults to now. The date must be specified in UTC, according to ISO 8601.

parameters.name: callType
parameters.description: Name or id of a call type. Return only SLA services where the service is available for to the specified call type.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Name (default language only) or id of a category for incidents. Return only SLA services where the service is available for to the specified category.

parameters.name: subcategory
parameters.description: Name (default language only) or id of a subcategory for incidents. Return only SLA services where the service is available for to the specified subcategory.

parameters.name: asset
parameters.description: Name, object id or asset id. Return only SLA services where the service is linked to the specified asset.

200.description:
_Sucess_
* Up to ```page_size``` entities have been found

206.description:
_Sucess_
* More than ```page_size``` entities have been found, but only so many are returned

400.description:
_Bad Request_
  • The parameters of the request were malformed

500.description:
_Internal Server Error_
  • Error occurred on the server

request.description: The request text that caused the incident without any formatting.

requests.description: The list endpoint where the separate request entries can be retrieved with html formatting.

action.description: The list endpoint where the separate action entries can be retrieved with html formatting.

attachments.description: The list endpoint where the attachments can be retrieved.

branchExtraFieldA.description: The extraA field of the callerBranch

branchExtraFieldB.description: The extraB field of the callerBranch

externalNumber.description:
External number.
Can only be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.

timeSpent.description:
The total time registered on this incident. Including when the incident was 1st line, 2nd line and, if this
incident is a second line incident, all time registered on partials belonging to it.  
For partial incident this field will be 0 as their time is added to the timeSpent of their parent incident.  
The time is returned as minutes.

timeSpentFirstLine.description:
Time registered on this incident while it was a 1st line incident.  
The time is returned as minutes.

timeSpentSecondLine.description:
Time registered on this incident while it was a 2nd line incident.  
The time is returned as minutes.

timeSpentPartial.description:
Time registered on this incident while it was a partial incident.  
The time is returned as minutes.

timeSpentLinkedPartials.description:
Time registered on partials belonging to this incident.  
The time is returned as minutes.

timeSpentSecondLineAndPartials.description:
WARNING: This name is very misleading as the field will not contain the time registered on partials.
DEPRECATED: Use _timeSpentSecondLine_ instead.

callerLookup.description:
Lookup value for filling in a registered caller's contact details.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
The caller is filled in automatically for persons.
Examples:
```
"callerLookup" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"callerLookup" : { "email" : "email@domain.com" }
```
It is an error to provide more than one lookup value or to provide an empty callerLookup object.

status.description: Status of the incident. Can only be set by operators.

briefDescription.description:
Brief description.
Can be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.
Can be set by persons only when the appropriate setting for the new call form is checked.

request.description:
Initial request. The following html tags can be used to format the text:
  • <i>
  • <em>
  • <b>
  • <strong>
  • <u>
  • <img> BASE64-encoding has to be used. Only pictures up to the size of 450x450 pixels are supported. Allowed picture-formats: gif, png, bmp, pcx, iff, ras, pnm, psd, jpg. Example: <img src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAA...">
  • <br>
  • <h5>
  • <h6>
Can be set by operators and persons.

action.description:
Initial action. The following html tags can be used to format the text:
  • <i>
  • <em>
  • <b>
  • <strong>
  • <u>
  • <img> BASE64-encoding has to be used. Only pictures up to the size of 450x450 pixels are supported. Allowed picture-formats: gif, png, bmp, pcx, iff, ras, pnm, psd, jpg. Example: <img src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAA...">
  • <br>
  • <h5>
  • <h6>
Can be set by operators and persons.

actionInvisibleForCaller.description:
Whether the initial action is invisible for persons.
Can only be set by operators.

id.description: Id of the item. Either id or name can be used to specify item.

name.description: Name of the item. Either name or id can be used to specify item.

entryType.description:
Entry type by id or name.
Can only be set by operators.
Example:
```
"entryType" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"entryType" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

id.description: Id of the item. Either id or name can be used to specify item.

name.description: Name of the item. Either name or id can be used to specify item.

callType.description:
Call type by id or name.
Can be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Can be set by persons only when the appropriate setting for the new call form is checked.
Example:
```
"callType" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or
```
"callType" : { "name" : "Name of Searchlist" }
```

id.description: Id of the item. Either id or name can be used to specify item.

name.description: Name of the item. Either name or id can be used to specify item.

category.description:
Category by id or name.
Can be set by operators.
For partials, if not provided, will be automatically copied from the main incident.
Can be set by persons only when the appropriate setting for the new call form is checked.
It is an error to provide both an id and a name.
Example:
```
"category" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }
```
or

request.description:
Initial request. The following html tags can be used to format the text:
  • <i>
  • <em>
  • <b>
  • <strong>
  • <u>
  • <img> BASE64-encoding has to be used. Only pictures up to the size of 450x450 pixels are supported. Allowed picture-formats: gif, png, bmp, pcx, iff, ras, pnm, psd, jpg. Example: <img src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAA...">
  • <br>
  • <h5>
  • <h6>
Can be set by operators and persons.

CallerCreate.description:
```
Using the caller parameter to fill in a registered caller is deprecated, use the callerLookup parameter instead.
```
The caller contact details for this incident.
Can only be set by operators.
Cannot be provided for partials as its automatically copied from the main incident.
Is filled in automatically for persons and when the callerLookup parameter is provided.
To fill in an unregistered caller, fill in the caller's name:
```
"caller" : { "dynamicName" : "Firstname Lastname" }
```
It is an error to provide both a name and a registered caller.

timeSpent.description:
Time spent in minutes. Can be negative as long as the total registered time on the incident does not go
below 0. Can not be 0.
Example: `"timeSpent": 30`

notes.description:
Notes for the entry of registered time spent
Example: `"notes": "Took a bit longer to find a patch than expected."`

entryDate.description:
Date for when the time spent should be registered. If not set, will be set to the current time.
Example: `"entryDate": : "2015-11-15T14:00:00.000+0200"`
The given time offset will be used. Without a given offset Zulu/UTC time will be assumed.
E.g. 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000 is equivalent to 2015-10-28T10:30:00.000+0000

operator.description:
Operator by id. If operator group and operator id is not set, currently logged in operator will be used.
Example: `"operator" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }`

operatorGroup.description:
Operator group by id. Must match with the specified operator. If no operator specified, operator group will
also be set as the operator.
Example: `"operatorGroup" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }`

reason.description:
The reason for the time spent by name or id. If id is set the name will be ignored.
Example: `"reason" : { "id" : "<UUID>" }` or `"reason" : { "name" : "Normal tariff" }`

id.description: The id of the SLA service. This is the value you need to link a SLA to an incident while creating or updating it.

BadRequest.description:
_Bad Request_
  • The incident id is invalid
  • The request contains a field that does not exist
  • The request contains a value for a field where the format is wrong. For example, "true" mistyped, or the UUID in the wrong format
  • The request contains a value for a string field which is too long. For example, brief description can only be 80 characters long
  • The request contains an operator which does not belong to the given operator group
  • The request contains a subcategory which does not belong to the given category
  • The request contains a supplier which is not applicable for the status of the incident
  • The request contains an invalid major call
  • The person tries to give feedback on an open incident
  • The request is for the creation of a partial incident and one of the fields marked as 'Cannot be provided for partials' is included in the request.
  • The request is for the creation of a partial incident and no main incident id is provided.

Forbidden.description:
_Forbidden_
  • The request contains a field that the person is not allowed to set
  • The operator does not have the rights to execute this operation

InternalServerError.description:
_Internal Server Error_
  • Error occurred on the server

NotFound.description:
_Not Found_
  • The incident number or id are valid, but incident does not exist
  • The request contains a field with an id value which is not existing in the database

start.name: start
start.description: The offset at which to start listing at

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: The amount of entities to be returned per request

inlineimages.name: inlineimages
inlineimages.description: Whether inline images should be returned

non_api_attachment_urls.name: non_api_attachment_urls
non_api_attachment_urls.description: Whether links to bigger versions of inline images should be returned in a format that can be used by a browser (with cookie authentication) instead of by an API user
